data.title: Official: Farouk to marry Sadek
data.meta_description: KING FAROUK, on the eve of his 31st birthday yesterday, formally announced his engagement to Narriman Sadek, pretty 17-years-old commoner. ...
data.text:
Twelve months ago Farouk

"outlawed" his youngest sis-

ter, Princess Fathia, for

marrying a commoner.

The engagement of Sadck,

daughter of a civil servant, to a

young Egyptian diplomat, Zaki

Hackern, was broken in Decem-

ber, 1949, a few days before their

intended marriage.

Farouk met Sadek in a

jeweller's shop In Cairo toward

the end of -1949. So impressed

was he by her youth and beauty,

that he immediately began his

siege of love.

Shortly before, King Farouk

had divorced Queen Farida. Tneir

ten years' marriage had not given

him an heir.

A palace communique says:

"On this blessed day, when the

country celebrates in joy and

gladness the glorious anniversary

of the Royal birth, there has

taken place by the grace of God,

the engagement of our beloved

Sovereign with a descendant of

an illustrious noble family-Miss

Narriman Hanem, daughter of

the late Hussein Fahmy Sadek

Bey, son of the late Aly Sadek

Bey. son of the late Mohamed

Sadek Pasha."

In a national broadcast,

Nanas Pasha, Premier, said the

marriage with "one of the love-

liest of flowers" would strengthen

the ties between the Throne and

the people.

The whole of Egypt is rejoicing.

Gay flags are hanging in every

town, city, and village, and public

buildings are floodlit. Special

arches span the main roads and

ships in the harbors are fully

dressed in King Farouk's honor.

Free meals are being served

for poor people at soup kitchens.

Sweets and clothes are being dis-

tributed to mothers in maternity

clinics, and extra food and sweets

are being given to hospital

patients and to waifs and strays,
